page.title: 07The Tower of St Peter's.
page.content: St Peter's church tower is unusual because it is separated from the main body of the church. This happened because years ago when the church was made into a college for monks, their living quarters were built in the tower. You can still see the fireplaces up high in the walls but the floors have gone. To the north east of the tower are two underground vaulted rooms. The kitchen which was used by the monks is still there. It is called "Old Marlows Parlour". The medieval oven can be seen. There is a fine vaulted roof, a carved date and masons marks. The tower is 99 feet high crowned by an octagonal lantern. In earlier times this lantern was lit to guide travellers across the dangerous river valley.
